content.prompt: Which of the following best explains why most research about the effects of teratogens during pregnancy is correlational rather than experimental?

choices.label: It would be unethical to manipulate the exposure to teratogens during a pregnancy due to the potential harm to individuals.
Only correlational research can prove cause and effect relationships in research on teratogens.
Because teratogens are related to a critical period for learning language, it would be unethical to deprive babies of learning to speak a language.
Correlational research can demonstrate statistical significance while experiments do not involve the use of statistical significance measures, making correlational research more accurate.

skill.text: 2.D: Evaluate whether a psychological research scenario followed appropriate ethical procedures.
